rooms.description: Corner location with space for two cars. Designed with reinforced concrete structure and exposed brick finishes to align with Brutalist aesthetics.
A spacious entrance area leading to living areas, ensuring proper Vastu alignment by placing the main door in the south-east direction.

Open-plan space with exposed concrete elements and minimalistic furniture, optimized for sunlight during morning hours. Large windows are placed on the east side to allow ample light while maintaining privacy.

Compact yet functional kitchen area placed adjacent to the living room for easy access. Uses durable materials in line with Brutalist aesthetics and complies with local building norms by including safety outlets and ventilation per Vastu recommendations.
Small, functional bathroom integrated into the living space. Designed to be accessible and maintain privacy using frosted glass windows in accordance with local norms and aesthetic guidelines.

openings.description: Main entry door aligned with Vastu principles for positive energy flow, ensuring stability and a welcoming atmosphere.
Provides direct access to the two-car garage from the property. Designed with robust materials that reflect the Brutalist design language.
Large window offering natural light and a view, enhancing the open feel of the living space while maintaining privacy.
